title: Gujarati Sahitya Parishad
text:
Gujarati Sahitya Parishad (Gujarati Literary Council) is a literary organisation for the promotion of <a href="Gujarati%20literature">Gujarati literature</a> located in <a href="Ahmedabad">Ahmedabad</a>, <a href="Gujarat">Gujarat</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. It was founded by <a href="Ranjitram%20Mehta">Ranjitram Mehta</a> with the aim of creating literature appealing to all classes of society and cultivating a literary sense among the people. Many prominent people including <a href="Mahatma%20Gandhi">Mahatma Gandhi</a> and <a href="Kanaiyalal%20Munshi">Kanaiyalal Munshi</a> have presided over the organisation. Its headquarters, located on <a href="Ashram%20Road">Ashram Road</a>, is known as Govardhan Bhavan. It has a conference hall and library.
"Parab" is the monthly magazine of the Gujarati Sahitya Parishad and is published on the 10th of every month.
Activities.
It published seven volumes of the "History of Gujarati Literature", of which the first volume covers a period of 1150 A.D to 1450 A.D. A weekly poetry workshop known as <a href="Budh%20Sabha">Budh Sabha</a> is held on every Wednesday at the World Poetry Center of Parishad.
